attributes.action: Amend 'Public Health (Control of Disease) Act 1984' to legalise human composting
attributes.background:
The Public Health Act includes provision for "Green burials" where human remains are buried in a biodegradable casket but "composting" has not yet been legalised under these regulations.
Human composting happens above ground in a vessel that allows the body to become compost in 30-60 days.
attributes.additional_details:
After death care is a very personal preference and the more choices that people have, the better.
Traditional burial and cremation, until recently were the only funerary options. Both are environmentally damaging.
Green burials are another great choice, but still take up valuable land.
Being able to renourish soil or a tree with the compost of a loved one is the ultimate option in returning from where we all came.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Require packaging that clearly details the environmental impact of products.
attributes.background: Food packaging has nutritional information on the front, using a traffic light system. In a similar way, details such as mean equivalent carbon emissions, land use, water use, ecological impact and resulting pollution should be clearly visible on the front of consumer goods packaging.
attributes.additional_details: Around 26% of global emissions come from food. Most individuals don't have the time to research the environmental impact of their consumables. Implementing this policy will help consumers make more environmentally friendly choices and put pressure on companies to develop products that are better for the planet. In addition, the need for companies to assess environmental impact will result in a boom of jobs in the environment sector. Britain will lead the world in enabling green consumer choices.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Impose new taxes on private jets to increase investment in renewables
attributes.background: The aviation industry emits 12% of all transport carbon dioxide emissions. We want the Government to impose new taxes on the use of private jets, to try and reduce CO2 emissions and raise funds to invest in renewable energy, green transportation, and electric vehicle infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details: I believe I can speak on behalf of the planet when I say, we have had enough. We desperately need to reduce the level of carbon emissions entering our atmosphere before we are responsible for the mass extinction of almost 90% of marine species, and the millions of individuals at risk from rising sea levels.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: All drivers to take a refresher course every 10 years.
attributes.background: Create a law that states every driver on the road must sit a competency test, (practical and theory) every 10 years. With a Green, Amber, Red scoring system. Green - Pass. Amber - Pass but must have some retraining. Fail - Must retrain and retest, can no longer drive on their current license.
attributes.additional_details: The roads are changing, the laws are changing yet no one is retrained to drive on our roads. Dangerous drivers will be removed from the roads making our roads much safer and CO2 emissions could be hugely reduced with less vehicles on the road. Safer roads means less incidents caused, which in turn creates a safer environment for everyone. The rates of car insurance could be significantly reduced as the risk of collision/injury will be cut.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Do not require a PCR covid test to return upon England from green list countries
attributes.background: The cost of covid PCR tests is outrageous and considerably more than the cost of buying a ticket to travel to see my family. If a country is on the green list it should be considered safe enough not to require a test when you return.
attributes.additional_details: Last week the UK Government came up with a green list of countries where you can travel without having to quarantine on arrival to UK. Although, there are some limitations, including having a valid PCR covid test on day 2 after arrival that needs to be done specifically on one of the sites listed on the government website. This rule doesn't make sense and these tests are not affordable for people like me. Am I free to go and see my family or not? Where are people supposed to get the money?

departments.name: Home Office

attributes.action: Make rooftop solar installations mandatory for all new homes valued over £400000
attributes.background: As the UK aims to reach net zero by 2050, it is important to ensure that rooftop solar becomes common place. I want new homes worth over £400000 to install rooftop solar as many cant afford to. These homes also are generally larger than lower valued homes and as a result use more electricity.
attributes.additional_details: The government should encourage the installation of rooftop solar for all home buyers and constructions around the country. Rooftop solar will be a vital step towards the goal of net zero as it will take homes off grid, handing control back to the home owner. Rooftop solar will also help to green the grid with a rapid expansion of the renewable technology with the impending housing construction boom. Rooftop solar will also make the grid more resilient and reduce the effect of blackouts on homes

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Fund fruit trees for public parks and green spaces
attributes.background: The Government should fund schemes to plant edible fruit trees in public green spaces and parks. This would help those who are struggling for food to eat something even if it is just a piece of fruit.
attributes.additional_details: Following the cost of living crisis, it makes logical sense to help tackle this with the introduction of fruit trees in parks such as apple trees. Not only is this good for the environment but will also help tackle the shortage of food and provide the public with a form of natural food.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Fund the planting of wildflowers along all public green spaces
attributes.background: We would like the Government pledge funding to plant a 1-meter wide strip of wildflowers along the length of every public green space (i.e. playing fields, grass verges etc). Councils would be allocated a grant to achieve this target. The target would be set by the Government.
attributes.additional_details:
The data shows the UK has experienced extinctions and declines in abundance, biomass and distribution of insects. Declines in abundance or distribution have been seen in bees and hoverflies, butterflies and moths, beetles, and freshwater insects. There are a variety of drivers behind insect decline, such as habitat loss, chemical use and climate change, and their impacts differ across habitat, species and time.
 
Source: UK Insect Decline and Extinctions, UK Parliament POST https://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/POST-PN-0619/POST-PN-0619.pdf

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Put Portugal back on the green list
attributes.background: We believe the decision to remove Portugal from the green list is completely irrational and indefensible. Covid rates in Portugal have not risen dramatically. New daily case numbers are almost identical to those in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Portugal was apparently safe at the end of May for Chelsea and Manchester fans. Now it is considered dangerous. This decision is a massive blow to the Portuguese economy.

The major concern is that this government is making irrational, flawed decisions. The data to support these is never revealed. It is terrifying and the Government needs to be held to account.

This is not a problem for Portugal alone. There are many other countries who are almost certainly being discriminated against.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Allow UK vaccinated residents to transit through France with no quarantine
attributes.background: A lot of UK residents are going to travel to Europe this summer. The Government has just enforced that vaccinated residents will need to quarantine if returning to the UK from France, even if only transiting. We ask not to apply a quarantine to UK residents transiting through France this summer.
attributes.additional_details: France's geographical location makes it the main point of entry in the UK from Europe. Enforcing a quarantine for vaccinated UK  residents who are transiting through  France, means that most vaccinated UK residents visiting a european country will need to quarantine, even though the european destination is green or amber on the travel list.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Stop proposed investment zones
attributes.background:
The Government needs to cancel all plans to create investment zones as part of its "growth plan".
 
There are fears that these investment zones will be an "attack on nature".
attributes.additional_details:
Part of the plans for these zones is that they will bring forward additional development, including a mix of both commercial and residential development, and there are fears this will involve development of land that is part of AONBs, national parks and other green belt land.
 
These investment zones could reduce requirements for new developments, and so lead to additional development of, and adverse environmental effects on, the countryside.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Introduce double green lines for in front of on-street EV charge points
attributes.background: We would like to see the introduction of double green lines in front of on-street electric charge points, with penalties for improper parking in front of these charge points comparable to those of parking on double yellow lines.
attributes.additional_details:
To encourage the uptake of electric vehicles, we need to overcome any real problems that are a barrier to the uptake.
 
One of the biggest concerns for people resistant to making the change is access to electric vehicle charging points, particularly for people who will rely on on-street charge points.
 
There is one ongoing problem that needs to be urgently addressed. Non-plug in vehicles blocking access to charge points. This is an issue that has plagued electric vehicle drivers for years.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Make ‘can be recycled’ labelling clearer on all products
attributes.background: The government should require manufacturers to introduce red /green stickers on their products – red if it can’t be recycled, green if it can, and amber if mixed plastic, to make it clearer for consumers.
attributes.additional_details: This would help towards saving the environment. Not everyone recycles, sometimes people can be confused around the packaging on items as some plastics are non-recyclable - making this unclear for some who want to make a contribution to the recycling programme.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the manufacture of all products containing plastic in the UK
attributes.background: I want the Government to make the UK a no-go zone for the production of ethylene, plastic pellets or any other plastic products.
attributes.additional_details: I need the Government to do this because it requires a major change in our society. People need to be convinced by having scientific and other green technologies back the change. Biodegradable products made out of natural materials would need to be more widely used. This could result in different products being grown and harvested to make them. To support people working in these industries who might be put out of a job, I would expect the Government to ensure that transition training is provided to help these people secure green jobs.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Subsidise electricity costs for Electric Vehicle owners and EV charging points
attributes.background:
As consumers we are advised to go green and have a green agenda to get us there. But the increasing energy costs are a barrier to this.
 
I urge the Government to come up with a mechanism to subsidise electricity costs for Electric Vehicle owners and Public EV charging point operators.
attributes.additional_details: With the electricity Bill's raising nearly 54% in April 2022, subsidised energy costs would help encourage more people to switch to Electronic Vehicles, and help get us closer to achieving our green agenda targets.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Create a ten-year interest free loan for domestic green energy transition
attributes.background: The Government should create funding in the form of an interest-free loan repayable over (up to) ten years for people to spend on solar, heat pump or insulation projects as appropriate to their domestic situation (including community energy proposals).
attributes.additional_details:
We believe the current energy sector model is creating misery for millions and wrecking any hope of a decent future for future generations. Alternatives exist now to help tackle many of our problems regarding the climate, cost of living and long-term energy security.

This is a critical moment to incentivise people to transition. In the same time it will take to get new nuclear up and running we could reduce peoples' energy costs, massively boost UK-based industry and get a lot closer to meeting our net zero targets.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Cancel HS2
attributes.background: The construction of HS2 is destroying green land and homes, and will benefit only a small proportion of people. We want the Government to cancel this scheme immediately.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs
Department for Transport

attributes.action: Reduce the electricity Green Levy for home Heat Pump owners to the same as gas
attributes.background:
Make heat pump ownership less expensive as a matter of urgency in order to encourage uptake and achieve zero-carbon earlier.

The electricity for them costs 4 times more than gas running an equivalent gas boiler. Heat pumps may be 3 times more efficient but, for many, the numbers don’t stack up.
attributes.additional_details:
Plans to gradually equalise the green levies on gas and electricity have been shelved because of the energy crisis. Yet at the same time, Government seeks to encourage the uptake of heat pumps. Unfortunately, their running costs are a big disincentive for many and those costs are artificially increased by the x 10 difference between the ‘green tax’ treatment of gas and electricity even though electricity is greener.

Please stop penalising those who want to do the right thing by the planet!

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Add Greece to the UK 'Green' Travel List as of 17th May 2021.
attributes.background: To seriously reconsider the decision of not adding Greece and her islands to the UK Green Travel list. As of 6th May 2021, ALL of Greece is showing Green = less than 4% positivity rate, on the ECDC Map same as the Azores and Madeira which are included in the UK's Green List!
attributes.additional_details:
Greece's tourism accounts for over a quarter of the countrys GDP therefore its imperative that the country opens to UK tourism asap with it being one of its largest markets. 

Greece has handled the pandemic incredibly well with very strict measures enforced for over 1 year and still ongoing - even more strict than the UK and therefore should not be regarded as a high risk for travel. The economic impact of another reduced Summer season could be devastating for the country's economy and citizens.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Make new Public transport manufactured after 2030 electric.
attributes.background: The government should legislate to not only end the sale of new diesel and petrol cars by 2030 but should also ensure new public transport does not run-on diesel or petrol by the same date.
attributes.additional_details: Buses also create almost a kilogram of CO2 pollution every kilometre (860g / Km). TfL in 2018 - 19 had 455.2 Million miles of bus routes planned of which 98.36% of those were completed. That resulted in 391.472 million kilograms of CO2 pollution to enter into the air in just one year and the UK should seek to lead the world in green public transport. Electric buses by 2030 would be a considerable objective to aim towards.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Fund bubble barriers in the Thames to stop plastic from reaching the ocean
attributes.background: A bubble barrier is a green solution that was found to stop 86% of plastic reaching the ocean during a recent test in the river IJessel in the Netherlands. It is said to be easy to install and very efficient. The Government should fund multiple bubble barriers for the Thames.
attributes.additional_details: Multiple bubble barriers in the Thames should stop most plastic from reaching the ocean, helping to preserve wildlife and the plastic that the bubble barrier stops could be collected and recycled.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban the importation of wood pellets used for the generation of electricity.
attributes.background: Importation of wood pellets should be banned and the use in power stations should be urgently reviewed. Burning of wood pellets must not be considered sustainable or a means of meeting net zero targets. Billions of UK green subsidies into this technology must stop.
attributes.additional_details: Using wood pellets releases more CO2 than burning coal. Because the government considers wood pellets as a renewable resource, by re-planting trees, the emissions are classed as carbon neutral and “helps” to get closer to the neutral target in 2030. This is not the case. Deforestation is happening around the world to supply the UK with wood pellets for burning, which generates around 11% of our energy needs. British taxpayers are funding this destruction of forests.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Allow Registered Paramedics, Midwives and Nurses to use Green Beacons
attributes.background: Change the Road Vehicle lighting Regulations to include Registered Paramedics, Midwifes and Nurses.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the legislation around the use of Green lights was created, much of the clinical care provided by Doctors is now delivered by Paramedics and Nurses. Many Paramedics and Nurses are now working in a primary care setting and may need to reach a patient urgently to deliver care to reduce suffering and save lives. 

Midwives also are required to attend births with complications where time is of the essence and the use of Green Beacons may save lives. 

It's time the legislation caught up.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Ban the use of plastic gloves at petrol stations
attributes.background: Plastic gloves, used in petrol stations, end up in bushes, trees, fields. They can reach rivers, lakes and oceans. Banning their use at petrol stations should help reduce harm to the environment.
attributes.additional_details: These plastic gloves are strewn over our green belt and protected nature reserve areas. They can be extremely dangerous to plants, animals and insects & end up in water ways and ultimately breakdown and can enter the human food chain. These plastics can be incredibly hard to collect as they blow around.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Add green infrastructure as a nationally significant project to the Planning Act
attributes.background: The Planning Act is heavily focused on infrastructure, such as road, rail and energy. We need legislation that enables conservation bodies (Environment Agency, Natural England) to apply for planning consent, including compulsory acquisition, for green infrastructure for the good of the nation.
attributes.additional_details: Green infrastructure is a planned network of natural and semi-natural spaces with other environmental features designed to deliver a range of ecosystem services. The Government should do this to promote importance of the UK environment and conservation in its national planning. At present, the legislation is centred around mitigation, when there should be a greater promotion of new green infrastructure. It should be up to the planning authority to determine whether there is a 'Case for the Scheme' in the interest to the public. Currently there is no mechanism for green infrastructure schemes to come forward and be assessed.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Increase UK green energy investment in geothermal sources
attributes.background: For every kilometre drilled into earth, the temperature increases by 25-30 degrees Celsius. The deeper the holes the hotter and more constant the temperature. This can power both heating systems and electrical energy production 100% of the time.
attributes.additional_details: Green energy is our future. Recently gas supply scares mean we are not 100% energy capable. Geothermal energy is 24/7. Not depending on sun or wind. Installed can run for 100 years almost maintenance free and not require much pumps capacity. In COP26 the UK could commit 'cross party' to this being the focus of investment creating jobs and the global expertise on this industry. These don't leave us with unsightly installations (solar/wind) 1 system every 60km sq. in the UK would power all homes.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Create a new vehicle category for E-bikes with a top speed of 30mph
attributes.background: Reclassify E-bikes that can reach a top speed of 30mph into their own class of Motor vehicles. This should include the use of a headlight and rear light at night; a legal requirement for helmets and insurance, as well as an age restriction to 18+ and, have at least a provisional license.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a massive explosion of E-bike's seen globally and in the UK.
The current laws limit the pedelec E-bikes to 15mph and a 250w motor. 

This is inadequate as it creates a large speed deficit between E-bike users and traditional road users which is a major safety concern.
The current speed limit stops potential users from replacing their cars for travel, while other users bypass the law altogether and derestrict their bikes. The law's should be updated to reflect current green initiatives.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Council Tax reduction for people on private estates paying management fees
attributes.background: Council don't deliver all of their services for a lot of private estates so it's unfair residents have to pay the full amount of Council Tax.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people have to pay a separate fee to a management company for the following maintenance; roads, footpaths, play parks, green spaces and any landscaping.
 
We shouldn't pay full Council Tax when we do not receive all services funded by this. Therefore, Council Tax should be reduced accordingly to make it fair.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Invest in new night trains & regional Eurostar services for the North of the UK
attributes.background:
The climate emergency and the COVID-19 pandemic has shown that we need to invest to stop the climate crisis. 

A new public works programme investing in international train travel should create new, green jobs and investment opportunities for the North of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Without proper devolution, only Government and Parliament have the power, money and resources to kickstart such an investment programme.

Working people deserve access to travel & the North deserves world class public transport.

Parliament should vote to begin a new programme of night trains & regional Eurostars for the North.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Fund green apprenticeships
attributes.background: We are asking the government to fully fund apprenticeships for 16-19 year olds, making this central to a Green New Deal.
attributes.additional_details: Funding post-16 apprentices and putting them at the heart of a Green New Deal will enable the country to find its way out of the economic catastrophe and recession that has been created by the Covid-19 virus. Funding the sector in this way will also provide not only the skilled people (e.g. to replace gas boilers with heat exchangers NB approx 20k a week needed to meet CO2 targets) but also much need R&D into the new decarbonisation technologies that will be required.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Introduce taxes on aviation kerosene
attributes.background: In keeping with its own levelling-up agenda, the UK Government should legislate for the immediate introduction of VAT and a fuel duty on aviation kerosene. UK motorists pay almost 50% tax for every litre of fuel they buy, while jet kerosene remains completely untaxed.
attributes.additional_details: During a cost of living crisis, it makes no fiscal or moral sense for aviation fuel to be exempt from tax. Yet air travel operators are in a privileged position. The argument is made even stronger by the current climate emergency, with viable green air travel options decades away. Taxing airline fuel could therefore have the additional benefit of helping curb current growth in the sector to help meet the Government’s own ambitious emissions targets.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Create new green planning requirements for residential properties
attributes.background: We want the planning system to be used to require developers of new housing to have to put in a net gain of trees, hedging, etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Developers should also be required to use hedging and trees to divide plots, and not fences or brickwork, supporting going green and wildlife.
 
Over the years housing developments have been built on greenfield sites, this has resulted in wildlife habitat being lost but also has resulted in loss of carbon capture via loss of trees, grass, etc.
 
The COP26 highlights the need for tree planting to reduce CO2 in the atmosphere one of the ways this could be achieved is by demanding housing developments provide green boundaries for plots, this should result in miles of hedging and trees being planted.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Revoke planning permission for the planned West Midlands Interchange
attributes.background: Cancel the planning consent to carve up the green belt land to replace it with concrete and steel warehouses.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst agreeing that we need more freight off the roads and more on our rail network, we cannot sacrifice our virgin countryside when other industrialised or urban land is available near Birmingham.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Go up not out and reuse existing buildings - ban all building on green space
attributes.background:
There must be no more using of green land for building.
Reuse existing buildings such as offices.
New build must be at least three storeys high  preferably more, with a communal garden.
attributes.additional_details:
Farmland and green spaces are being filled with housing at an alarming rate.
Whole areas are becoming unrecognisable and there is huge effect on wildlife and natural water control.
Building ever outwards is a luxury we can no longer afford. 
New build must be presumed to go up not out: like other countries with shortage of land we must start to build more homes on the same space with roof and community gardens.
The assumption that everyone will have a private garden can no longer be the case.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Reinstate the Green Homes Grant with free certification training
attributes.background:
Flaws in the scheme mean tradespeople have struggled to get the expensive certification required to undertake the work in time for the March deadline. 

By extending the scheme and providing free, certified training more tradespeople will be able to provide the service, so people could use it
attributes.additional_details:
This initiative is important for the planet and for the jobs it has the potential to create. 

Hundreds of thousands of people can benefit from the scheme, it's just been executed poorly so far. Instead of pulling it why don't they fix it? 

If they make it easier for installers to become accredited, there will be people available to do the works and people would apply.

Tradespeople across the country who have spent thousands to be involved with the scheme have just been left high and dry.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Give solar panels on residential properties legally protected rights to light
attributes.background: The Government should protect rights to light for residential solar panels by:
attributes.additional_details:
1. Extending right to light legislation to include solar panels.
2. Adding caveats to 'Permitted Development' laws to protect solar panels.
3. Ensuring Party Wall Agreements don't affect rights to light of solar panels.

At present I believe the Government's 'GREEN' policies are contradictory They are not fit for purpose because different policies can work against its commitment to carbon emission reduction targets.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Impose a Robin Hood tax on banker bonuses as part of the Covid economic recovery
attributes.background: The debate isn’t if the Robin Hood tax should be implemented, it’s why hasn’t it been implemented already.
attributes.additional_details:
Rather than once again freezing the pay of much of the public sector, we ask that a very small percentage of the bonuses banks pay their staff is taxed & used to help support the NHS, other public services & green initiatives.

Even with the most optimistic impact that covid and brexit will have on our economy, we cannot afford to safeguard the populations wellbeing without this tax or similar taxes in function and source.

The wellbeing of the population during this time will rely upon the key steps the government takes during the economic  recovery period & proportionality taxing the additional bonus income of those in banking is one of them.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Bring the Green Homes Grant Voucher Scheme back!
attributes.background: Bring the GHGVS scheme back in order to attract the private owners of Solid Wall properties to have their properties insulated in an attempt to meet the Net Zero by 2050 target.
attributes.additional_details:
It was said that the grant wasn’t efficient enough and less than 10% of the funding was spent. In this case our suggestion is for the remainder of the amount to be rolled over to next year and the year after.

Installers that took part in GHGVS last year and were successful are ready to grow which means that every year we can grow therefore absorb more funding and insulate more properties. 

I really think that improving something that worked is the way forward.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Add Greece and Cyprus to the Government’s “Green List” of travelling!
attributes.background: Add Greece and Cyprus to the Green List of travelling. It is unacceptable to have to quarantine for 10 days for travelling (whilst carrying a negative COVID test. By taking the day 2 test, we ensure that we didn’t carry anything with us while travelling. So why quarantine for 10 days then?
attributes.additional_details:
Not only because it is within our basic rights to be free to travel whenever we want, when we want to, but also because for a lot of people, this decision will allow us to visit our friends and family! Not everyone travels for vacation. 
Furthermore, it is a chain of support for everyone. Flying companies and everyone who is working on the travelling or tourist industry will be able to keep their jobs and support their families if things get back to normal and people are allowed to travel freely

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Add the USA to the Green List
attributes.background: More than half of the populations of UK and USA have had at least one vaccine. The USA's status as an Amber list country is unclear and transatlantic travel needs to be urgently reinstated, by adding the USA to the green list.
attributes.additional_details: Resuming international travel between the USA and UK is important not only for economic purposes (holiday, business etc) but to reunite families. The Government cannot claim that the vaccination programme has been a "success" if it doesn't allow those who have done their civic duty and got the vaccine to have their freedoms back.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Allow residents to come back freely if traffic light was green at departure
attributes.background: I suggest to change the way colour system works. If the person leaves UK when the colour is green and comes back within 2 weeks, then they should be treated as one who came back to green colour (even if the colour changed to red) if their test is negative.
attributes.additional_details: Government introduced a traffic system for arrivals to UK. I strongly recommend to change the way it works because it does not allow UK residents to go on holiday and relax. It affects productivity and stress levels are increasing. As stated by Government, the colour from green to amber can change overnight - meaning that if the person is on holiday, he will be tensed that he might need to quarantine on arrival or even pay thousands to quarantine in the hotel in case colour changes into red.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Allow Coastguards & RNLI to use green lights to attend incidents.
attributes.background: To allow Coastguards & RNLI to use green lights on vehicles to ease traffic and make other road users aware that they are on their way to a life dependent situation. (either directly to an incident or to a station to collect an emergency vehicle / boat)
attributes.additional_details: Every day lives are dependant on Coastguard & RNLI. Currently, for example; during a rush hour it may take you 30-40 minutes to get to your station / incident when lives are at risk. Most incidents require a number of team to be on scene to carry out certain applications of rescue. Green lights would not give exemptions to traffic rules but would allow road users to know that an incident is being attended to and could therefore ease congestion en route to an incident, scene or station.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Replace nuclear power with hybrid-solar-battery power in the energy strategy
attributes.background: We the undersigned, want the government to replace monolithic, stagnating nuclear power in the energy strategy with roof-based, modular, sustainable, rapidly evolving hybrid-solar-battery systems and insulation for all social-housing. Batteries will supply baseload power when the sun doesn’t shine.
attributes.additional_details: Installing hybrid-solar-battery systems and insulation for about 4 million social-houses could immediately add an ever-increasing capacity each year, taking less than 5 years to reach full capacity. The power costs less than £44/MWh and could provide over 16 TW baseload per year which could replace about half of current Russian gas energy imports. It could create about 50 thousand long-term service jobs and take-up no extra land. It produces zero pollution from free UK sunlight and, year-on-year, drives down unit costs to grow our green industries and generate more tax revenue. The government could reduce benefits in line with about 50% energy savings in social-housing households to recoup the capital investment in as little as 6 years.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Create a fund to retrain workers in high-carbon industries
attributes.background: The Government should put in place funding to retrain workers in high-carbon industries, many of whom have lost their jobs during the Covid-19 pandemic, with skills that can support a green recovery.
attributes.additional_details: Retraining workers in these industries would both support workers who may have lost their jobs to find new employment, and could help support a green recovery, by training them in new skills that could be deployed in other industries, such as renewables.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Require plastic food containers to contain a minimum percentage recycled plastic
attributes.background: Houses need to have a minimum of insulation. Petrol must contain a minimum of ethanol. We should introduce a minimum requirement that plastic food containers manufactured or sold in the UK (bottles, food packaging, etc) contain a minimum percentage of recycled plastic and to increase this over time.
attributes.additional_details: This will aid in reducing fossil fuel usage and contribute towards green energy commitments. It is consistent with government policy and prior  initiatives to encourage business uptake through legislation

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Make recycling information a legal requirement on the front packaging.
attributes.background:
Make it a legal requirement for products to show recycling information on the front of packaging, utilising a traffic light system, alongside health information. 

Too often it is easy for people to not fully understand how and what to recycle. The traffic light system for nutrition works well!
attributes.additional_details:
A traffic light system on the front of packaging to show ease of recycling as a legal requirement. For example:  Green for majority of packaging widely recycled. Yellow for less than half of packaging recyclable or only recycled at larger facilities. Red for 25% or less recyclable. 

This will allow consumers to make a quick decision at a glance when shopping to make good choices. It will not solve the problem, recycling facilities need improvement and plastic alternative options need exploring

attributes.action: Block proposed 18m Three phone mast at junction of Hallowes Dr and Hazel Close
attributes.background:
Refuse Three network the planning permission they need to install 18 meter 5G mast next to our homes. 

We as a community are extremely concerned about this proposal and we absolutely stand together in opposing potential plans to install an 18 meter 5G mast in front of our homes on Hallowes Drive.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some of our main concerns:

Health hazards to community including small children

Protected green space 

Visual impact of mast and equipment in keeping with the area

Devaluing of properties 

Intrusive, grotesque and absolutely not appropriate close to so many homes 

No consultation 

Mental health and well-being concerns

attributes.action: Stop the introduction of ULEZ in outer London boroughs.
attributes.background: Sadiq Khan is proposing all London boroughs should be ULEZ areas meaning hundreds of thousands of motorbike, van, lorry and car users will have to pay £12.50 per day to use their car. We ask the government to direct the Mayor of London to investigate alternatives to ULEZ in outer London boroughs
attributes.additional_details:
The mayor has already imposed massive expansion and ever-increasing hikes to the congestion charge. The proposed ULEZ changes are another huge burden on London road users who already pay some of the highest fees to drive locally than anywhere else in Europe. 

We ask the government to stop the mayor from using vehicle owners as London cash cows and offer alternatives such as:
* Introducing green discounts on newer vehicles
* Green scrappage schemes
* Green travel discounts for using public transport

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Revoke local government powers to charge CAZ, LEZ, and ULEZ: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599985
